column4: as an aside, I now understand why everyone says to get an external modem
what one were you trying to use?
I got it working, it's a lucent version. It's just a pain, and the install docs I got where not 'quite' right
so what seems to be the problem?
well, linmodems/techion/packages/ltmodem/kernel-2.6/ubuntu-install.html was close, but not quite. But, I am using the darn thing now.
it's been a few years since I used a modem, but I remember there being problems then. I ended up buying new ones just to get it working.
I'll be buying an external tomorrow.
I found that US Robotics made an internal one that worked for me back then.
I have a zoom isa in the other machine. I didn't realize just how good I had it.
don't know about zoom
probably the same as your us robotics, just address it as a serial port.
my modem was internal on an ISA slot
the same
I'll have to look into aptitude. Never used it, but I've heard of it
check the wiki, it has a survival guide
thanks, I will
you can use garnome or jhbuild, they're on the gnome.org site. Be sure to strip all the ubuntu packages first, though
I'd like to stay as much Ubuntu as possible
I screwed the pooch upgrading also, but that was probably my fault from semi-adequate handling of problems in the preview.
yes that can, just do the verify stuff: http:wiki.ubuntu.com/VerifyIsoHowto
